entry.title: CTV + CSFS: a letter
entry.summary:
In December 2024, a wiki page dedicated to various use cases was created. This page, however, excludes certain functionalities such as LN SYMMETRY and other capabilities enabled by the combination of CHECKSIGFROMSTACK with CHECKTEMPLATEVERIFY. The discussion further highlights that there were no issues found with the language used or the intentions behind the letter signed by several contributors. Despite this, there's an acknowledgment of potential misinterpretations that could either be genuine misunderstandings or deliberate attempts to delay the process. To address any possible confusion and maintain a focus on the technical aspects of the discussion, a suggestion was made to rephrase one of the paragraphs.
The effort put forth by James O'Beirne and others who showed their support through signing the letter is appreciated within the communication. It's also noted that most users have a preference for public discussions regarding soft forks, indicating a broader community interest in transparency and open dialogue about development changes. This emphasis on clear communication and public engagement underscores the community's commitment to ensuring that advancements in technology are accessible and understandable to all involved parties. The inclusion of links within the message, like the [use cases](URL) and the suggested [rephrasing](URL), provides direct access to the resources discussed, facilitating further exploration of the topics mentioned.
